English: I am convinced that he is innocent.

French: Je suis convaincu de son innocence.

English: I am convinced of his innocence.

French: Je ne regrette pas mes actes.

English: I want to have a cup of coffee.
I would like a cup of coffee.

French: Je n'arrive pas à réfléchir correctement.
Elles ne perdirent pas de temps.

English: I want to make it up to you.
What do you make of my {{c::pie}}?

French: Je suis responsable de cette mission.

English: I'm in charge of this mission.
I didn't want you to know.
French: Je ne voulais pas que tu {{c::saches}}.

English: The wind is {{c::blowing}} from the west.
The wind is blowing from the west.
The wind is blowing from the {{c::east}}.
The wind is blowing from the east.
The wind blows from the east.
I guess {{c::that'll}} be up to you.
French: Je suppose que ça dépendra de vous.
Je suis conscient de cette possibilité.

English: I'll make a cup of coffee.
I take {{c::pride}} in what i do.
French: Je suis fier de ce que je fais.

English: Give me the cup of coffee!

French: Je veux partir à la retraite.
Je ne connais pas trois langues.

English: I'm sorry, but i don't understand.

French: Je ne crois pas aux fantômes.
Vous ne devez pas le toucher.
Je ne crois pas aux banques.
